title: INVENTORY / DOCUMENTS
description: Interaction with the documents Evrart asks you to sign.

dialogueTree.title: White Envelope: "You take the legal documents out of..."
dialogueTree.text: You take the legal documents out of the envelope: a 12-40 month construction period and the zoning plan in the addendum. Underneath all this -- on the signature lines -- your little forgery.

links.title: You: "Look at the zoning plan."
links.text: Look at the zoning plan.

links.title: White Envelope: "The youth centre cuts into the ocea..."
links.text: The youth centre cuts into the ocean like the bow of some great modern ship. Apparently it's going to cover most -- if not all -- of the street and the square between the existing houses. It's three storeys tall.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "It's going to be awfully close to t..."
links.text: It's going to be awfully close to the already existing buildings. Almost wall to wall, practically integrating them into the youth centre.

links.title: Inland Empire: "This is either an ominous or cool a..."
links.text: This is either an ominous or cool architectural choice -- hard to say.

links.title: Conceptualization: "My money is on cool. Looks like a c..."
links.text: My money is on cool. Looks like a cubic pyrite.

links.title: You: ""Kim, what do you think of this?""
links.text: "Kim, what do you think of this?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm no property lawyer, but it loo..."
links.text: "I'm no property lawyer, but it looks fine," the lieutenant replies, flipping through the documents. "I like the print size. They're not selling or leasing anything. It's not a perfect solution, but..." He shrugs.

links.title: Rhetoric: "...how else are you going to build..."
links.text: ...how else are you going to build something? It's always inconvenient to build things, and citizens inevitably have disagreements over such construction projects, but there's no other way.

links.title: You: "Try to find a loophole in the deal."
links.text: Try to find a loophole in the deal.

links.title: Logic: "There is no loophole. The simple tr..."
links.text: There is no loophole. The simple truth is the current residents are going to lose their street access and for the next 12-40 months their lives will be dominated by constant construction noise right next door.

links.title: You: "What are the ramifications here?"
links.text: What are the ramifications here?

links.title: Logic: "There are none. The signatures of t..."
links.text: There are none. The signatures of the drunks are worthless and once Evrart is ready to start the construction, he'll need to actually get Lilienne and Isobel to sign.

links.title: You: "Good thing I got those drunks to si..."
links.text: Good thing I got those drunks to sign this.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes." The lieutenant nods. "Too ba..."
links.text: "Yes." The lieutenant nods. "Too bad we can't see Evrart's face when he finds out."

links.title: Logic: "That was a nice move, yes."
links.text: That was a nice move, yes.

links.title: Logic: "There is no loophole. The simple tr..."
links.text: There is no loophole. The simple truth is the current residents are going to lose their street access and for the next 12-40 months their lives will be dominated by constant construction noise right next door.

links.title: You: "What are the ramifications here?"
links.text: What are the ramifications here?

links.title: Logic: "There are none. Your forged signatu..."
links.text: There are none. Your forged signatures are worthless and once Evrart is ready to start the construction, he'll need to actually get Lilienne and Isobel to sign.

links.title: You: "Good thing I forged the signatures."
links.text: Good thing I forged the signatures.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes." The lieutenant nods. "Too ba..."
links.text: "Yes." The lieutenant nods. "Too bad we won't see Evrart's face when he finds out."

links.title: Logic: "That was a nice move, yes."
links.text: That was a nice move, yes.

links.title: Logic: "There is no loophole. The simple tr..."
links.text: There is no loophole. The simple truth is the current residents are going to lose their street access and for the next 12-40 months their lives will be dominated by constant construction noise right next door.

links.title: You: "What are the ramifications here?"
links.text: What are the ramifications here?

links.title: Logic: "Once the construction starts it'll..."
links.text: Once the construction starts it'll probably take a few months -- a year maybe -- for even the most stubborn occupants to get tired of living like this. After that they'll sell their property cheap and move out.

links.title: You: "Isobel and Lilienne have a rough 12..."
links.text: Isobel and Lilienne have a rough 12 to 40 months ahead of them.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I should have seen it," the lieute..."
links.text: "I should have seen it," the lieutenant says with regret. "The people in the village are going to move out on their own accord sooner or later."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""All we can do now is *not* mail th..."
links.text: "All we can do now is *not* mail these to Evrart's accountant." He pauses. "Your gun would probably stay missing though."

links.title: You: ""Damn it... I really need my gun --..."
links.text: "Damn it... I really need my gun -- and to see where this is going."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let's go get it then.""
links.text: "Let's go get it then."

links.title: You: ""Fuck these people. What have they..."
links.text: "Fuck these people. What have they ever done for me? We move on."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes -- being an *asshole* makes th..."
links.text: "Yes -- being an *asshole* makes this much easier. Let's go."

links.title: You: ""I don't need my gun. I'm not going..."
links.text: "I don't need my gun. I'm not going to mail it." (Cancel task.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant gives you a long loo..."
links.text: The lieutenant gives you a long look before speaking. "For what it's worth, I think you're doing the right thing. Firearms can be replaced. People not so much."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We'll need to find you a new weapo..."
links.text: "We'll need to find you a new weapon -- and we'll need to hope to finish the case without Evrart's help." He sighs.

links.title: You: "(Sigh.) "Okay, damn it... it sounds..."
links.text: (Sigh.) "Okay, damn it... it sounds like too much. Let's fucking mail it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes..." He reluctantly nods. "It's..."
links.text: "Yes..." He reluctantly nods. "It's probably the smart choice."

links.title: You: ""Alright, I'm ready to take the dam..."
links.text: "Alright, I'm ready to take the damage for the sake of my conscience."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You made the right choice." The li..."
links.text: "You made the right choice." The lieutenant smiles approvingly. "Now let's move out and solve this case."

links.title: You: "Damn it... I really need my gun."
links.text: Damn it... I really need my gun.

links.title: Logic: "No one would judge you. After all,..."
links.text: No one would judge you. After all, what is a cop without his gun? Is he really even a cop anymore?

links.title: You: "I don't need my gun. I'm not going..."
links.text: I don't need my gun. I'm not going to mail it.

links.title: Logic: "Putting the good of others before y..."
links.text: Putting the good of others before your own... You're a good man, Harry. A good and honourable man. And guns can be replaced -- people can't.

links.title: Logic: "You are of course going to have to..."
links.text: You are of course going to have to find a new weapon and hope you can finish this case without Evrart's help.

links.title: You: "Damn it... it sounds like too much...."
links.text: Damn it... it sounds like too much. I'm going to fucking mail.

links.title: Logic: "This is probably the smart choice...."
links.text: This is probably the smart choice. Now go mail the document and don't think about it anymore.

links.title: You: "Alright, I'm ready to take the dama..."
links.text: Alright, I'm ready to take the damage for the sake of my conscience.

links.title: Logic: "Okay. Cool. Honourable too. Just wa..."
links.text: Okay. Cool. Honourable too. Just walk away with your head held high.

links.title: Logic: "It's hard to imagine anyone endurin..."
links.text: It's hard to imagine anyone enduring these conditions. The stubborn ones might last for a year, but before 40 months are through, they'll sell their property for pennies and move on.

links.title: Logic: "You could always *not* mail the sig..."
links.text: You could always *not* mail the signatures to Evrart's accountant. But then you'll never see your gun again.

links.title: Logic: "There is no loophole. The simple tr..."
links.text: There is no loophole. The simple truth is the current residents are going to lose their street access and for the next 12-40 months their lives will be dominated by constant construction noise right next door.

links.title: You: "Wait, what are the ramifications of..."
links.text: Wait, what are the ramifications of this?

links.title: Logic: "Once the construction starts it'll..."
links.text: Once the construction starts it'll probably take a few months -- a year maybe -- for even the most stubborn occupants to get tired of living like this. After that they'll sell their property for cheap and move out.

links.title: You: "This is terrible. Poor people. Can'..."
links.text: This is terrible. Poor people. Can't I do something?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Of course... I should have seen it..."
links.text: "Of course... I should have seen it." The lieutenant frowns as he reads over the document again.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Evrart probably has eyes on us, bu..."
links.text: "Evrart probably has eyes on us, but..." He pauses to think. "If the second signature were to be somehow *wrong*..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "He won't say it outright, but he's..."
links.text: He won't say it outright, but he's suggesting forgery.

links.title: You: ""I was actually thinking of forging..."
links.text: "I was actually thinking of forging Isobel Sadie's signature..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He nods approvingly. "Not a decisio..."
links.text: He nods approvingly. "Not a decision I would normally condone, but, under the circumstances..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You probably don't have a pen." He..."
links.text: "You probably don't have a pen." He takes one out of his pocket. "Here, you can keep this. I have another one."

links.title: Logic: "Or! You *could* try to trick Evrart..."
links.text: Or! You *could* try to trick Evrart. Get someone random to sign the document. By the time the Union boss finds out, your business here will already be concluded.

links.title: You: ""I thought of forging Isobel Sadies..."
links.text: "I thought of forging Isobel Sadies signature, but then decided against it. But now I see it may be the right thing to do."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He nods. "Not the sort of act I wou..."
links.text: He nods. "Not the sort of act I would normally condone, but, under the circumstances, if done *discreetly*... it may be the only way to save what's left of the village."

links.title: You: ""I considered forgery and ruled it..."
links.text: "I considered forgery and ruled it out. It's illegal and unethical."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I am not sure whether working with..."
links.text: "I am not sure whether working with Evrart is particularly ethical either... But I understand and respect your position." He looks off to the side, deep in thought.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He feels guilty about failing to pr..."
links.text: He feels guilty about failing to protect the inhabitants of the fishing village from a greedy mob boss.

links.title: You: ""You're suggesting...""
links.text: "You're suggesting..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He purses his lips. "Forgery, yes...."
links.text: He purses his lips. "Forgery, yes. It would render the document invalid."

links.title: You: ""Oh yeah, let's do this.""
links.text: "Oh yeah, let's do this."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's not the sort of act I would n..."
links.text: "It's not the sort of act I would normally encourage, but, under the circumstances, if done *discreetly*... it may be the only way to save what's left of the village."

links.title: You: ""That's illegal. I expected more fr..."
links.text: "That's illegal. I expected more from you, Kim."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I am not sure whether working with..."
links.text: "I am not sure whether working with Evrart is particularly ethical either... But I understand and respect your position." He looks off to the side, deep in thought.

links.title: Logic: "Well, you *could* trick Evrart. Get..."
links.text: Well, you *could* trick Evrart. Get someone random to sign the document. By the time the Union boss finds out, your business here will already be concluded.

links.title: You: "I guess that's just the cost of pro..."
links.text: I guess that's just the cost of progress.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Of course... I should have seen it..."
links.text: "Of course... I should have seen it." He frowns as he reads over the document again. "People will move away on their own accord. I'm not sure they should..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "He is not altogether comfortable wi..."
links.text: He is not altogether comfortable with your contribution to progress in this instance.

links.title: Logic: "How very rational of you. Rational..."
links.text: How very rational of you. Rational of Evrart, too -- he will, no doubt, benefit from the village being abandoned.

links.title: Logic: "There is no loophole. The simple tr..."
links.text: There is no loophole. The simple truth is the current residents are going to lose their street access and for the next 12-40 months their lives will be dominated by constant construction noise right next door.

links.title: You: "Wait, what are the ramifications of..."
links.text: Wait, what are the ramifications of this?

links.title: Logic: "Once the construction starts it'll..."
links.text: Once the construction starts it'll probably take a few months -- a year maybe -- for even the most stubborn occupants to get tired of living like this. After that they'll sell their property for cheap and move out.

links.title: You: "This is terrible. Poor people. Can'..."
links.text: This is terrible. Poor people. Can't I do something?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I should have seen it." The lieute..."
links.text: "I should have seen it." The lieutenant frowns as he reads over the document again.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Evrart probably has eyes on us, bu..."
links.text: "Evrart probably has eyes on us, but..." He pauses to think. "We could try to get other people to sign this instead of those listed. *Or* you could forge their signatures yourself. By the time he finds out, we'll already be gone."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""However... We'll need access to th..."
links.text: "However... We'll need access to the coast before we do anything. Evrart won't believe you got villagers' signatures if you can't even get to the village." He shrugs. "You can try a forgery as soon as we can cross the water lock."

links.title: Logic: "Well, you *could* trick Evrart. Get..."
links.text: Well, you *could* trick Evrart. Get some random people to sign the document. By the time the Union boss finds out, your business here will already be concluded.

links.title: You: "I guess that's just the cost of pro..."
links.text: I guess that's just the cost of progress.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I should have seen it." He frowns..."
links.text: "I should have seen it." He frowns as he reads over the document again. "People will move away on their own accord. Yes, I suppose change always has a price."

links.title: Rhetoric: "He is not altogether comfortable wi..."
links.text: He is not altogether comfortable with your contribution to progress in this instance.

links.title: Logic: "How very rational of you. Rational..."
links.text: How very rational of you. Rational of Evrart, too -- he will, no doubt, benefit from the village being abandoned.

links.title: Logic: "Again, the document doesn't seem to..."
links.text: Again, the document doesn't seem to have any hidden clause. Maybe, just maybe, what you see is what you get with Mr. Evrart?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmmmm," the lieutenant hums, watch..."
links.text: "Hmmmm," the lieutenant hums, watching you examine the document again.

links.title: Logic: "There doesn't seem to be anything o..."
links.text: There doesn't seem to be anything of interest here. No fine print. You're smart. You can read.

links.title: You: "Okay, let's do this! (Commence the..."
links.text: Okay, let's do this! (Commence the forgery.)

links.title: Interfacing: "With a confident flourish you compl..."
links.text: With a confident flourish you complete your forgery. What do you see on the signature line?

links.title: You: "The name: "Isobel Sadie.""
links.text: The name: "Isobel Sadie."

links.title: Interfacing: "Indeed. To be honest, it does look..."
links.text: Indeed. To be honest, it does look very convincing. The calligraphy is close to superb. It might as well be her actual signature.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good. Evrart will have to start ov..."
links.text: "Good. Evrart will have to start over with his scheming." The lieutenant nods. "When she denies that this is her signature the document will be rendered null and void."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Any halfway competent notary shoul..."
links.text: "Any halfway competent notary should be able to handle this. *Not* getting her signature was probably the best thing to do."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now all we have to do is mail thes..."
links.text: "Now all we have to do is mail these. I think I saw a mailbox on the plaza."

links.title: Interfacing: "But it's not, and the document will..."
links.text: But it's not, and the document will be nullified if she disputes it. That means Evrart will have to start over.

links.title: Interfacing: "All you need to do now is mail the..."
links.text: All you need to do now is mail the signatures to Evrart's accountant in La Delta.

links.title: You: "Two names: *Isobel Sadie* and *Lili..."
links.text: Two names: *Isobel Sadie* and *Lilienne Carter*.

links.title: Interfacing: "Indeed. Your forgery looks very con..."
links.text: Indeed. Your forgery looks very convincing right next to Lilienne's actual signature. It might as well be real.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good. Evrart will have to start ov..."
links.text: "Good. Evrart will have to start over with his scheming." The lieutenant nods. "When Isobel disputes her signature the document will be rendered null and void."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Any halfway competent notary shoul..."
links.text: "Any halfway competent notary should be able to handle this. *Not* getting Isobel's actual signature was probably the best thing to do."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now all we have to do is mail thes..."
links.text: "Now all we have to do is mail these. I think I saw a mailbox on the plaza."

links.title: Interfacing: "But it is not, and the document wil..."
links.text: But it is not, and the document will be nullified if Isobel disputes it. That means Evrart will have to start over.

links.title: Interfacing: "All you need to do now is mail the..."
links.text: All you need to do now is mail the signatures to Evrart's accountant in La Delta.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "There was a mail delivery box in th..."
links.text: There was a mail delivery box in the plaza, near the corner of the bookstore.

links.title: Interfacing: "Indeed. They look distinctly differ..."
links.text: Indeed. They look distinctly different and very convincing. These might as well be their actual signatures.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good. Evrart will have to start ov..."
links.text: "Good. Evrart will have to start over with his scheming." The lieutenant nods. "When Isobel and Lilienne dispute the signatures the document will be rendered null and void."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Any halfway competent notary shoul..."
links.text: "Any halfway competent notary should be able to handle this. *Not* getting their actual signatures was probably the best thing to do."

links.title: Interfacing: "But they're not, and the document w..."
links.text: But they're not, and the document will be nullified if they dispute it. That means Evrart will have to start over.

links.title: Interfacing: "The pen is shaking in your hand as..."
links.text: The pen is shaking in your hand as you draw a pathetic little line.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This isn't going to work," the lie..."
links.text: "This isn't going to work," the lieutenant says, looking over your shoulder. "It doesn't even look like a name. Just a scratch mark."

links.title: You: ""Did I just ruin it?""
links.text: "Did I just ruin it?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, it's just a little line. Let's..."
links.text: "No, it's just a little line. Let's get an actual signature on top of it and it'll be fine."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, it's just a little line. Let's..."
links.text: "No, it's just a little line. Let's get an actual signature on top of it and it'll be fine."

links.title: You: "Keep drawing."
links.text: Keep drawing.

links.title: Interfacing: "The line gets even shakier and star..."
links.text: The line gets even shakier and starts to curve towards the bottom of the page.

links.title: You: "Have I ruined the document?"
links.text: Have I ruined the document?

links.title: Interfacing: "No, it's just a line. Forgery obvio..."
links.text: No, it's just a line. Forgery obviously isn't your strong suit -- sorry for suggesting it. If you get someone to *actually* sign this, it should be fine.

links.title: Interfacing: "No, it's just a line. Forgery obvio..."
links.text: No, it's just a line. Forgery obviously isn't your strong suit -- sorry for suggesting it. If you get someone to *actually* sign this, it should be fine.

links.title: You: "What have I done?"
links.text: What have I done?

links.title: Interfacing: "It appears you have drawn a line in..."
links.text: It appears you have drawn a line instead of a signature. A puny line. Looks like the late stages of dementia.

links.title: You: "Put the documents back in the envel..."
links.text: Put the documents back in the envelope. [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: White Envelope: "You take the legal documents out of..."
dialogueTree.text: You take the legal documents out of the envelope: a 12-40 month construction period and the zoning plan in the addendum. It's signed by 'Idiot Doom' Spiral and someone called 'Don't Call Abigail', apparently.

dialogueTree.title: White Envelope: "You take the legal documents out of..."
dialogueTree.text: You take the legal documents out of the envelope: a 12-40 month construction period and the zoning plan in the addendum. It's signed by 'Idiot Doom Spiral' and someone called 'Domwtclall Abheqoeel', apparently.

dialogueTree.title: White Envelope: "You take the legal documents out of..."
dialogueTree.text: You take the legal documents out of the envelope: a 12-40 month construction period and the zoning plan in the addendum. It's signed by Lilienne Carter and 'Idiot Doom Spiral'.

dialogueTree.title: White Envelope: "You take the legal documents out of..."
dialogueTree.text: You take the legal documents out of the envelope: a 12-40 month construction period and the zoning plan in the addendum. Underneath all this -- Lilienne's signature and your little forgery.

dialogueTree.title: White Envelope: "You take the legal documents out of..."
dialogueTree.text: You take the legal documents out of the envelope: a 12-40 month construction period and the zoning plan in the addendum. It's signed by Isobel Sadie and Lilienne Carter.

dialogueTree.title: White Envelope: "You take the legal documents out of..."
dialogueTree.text: You take the legal documents out of the envelope: a 12-40 month construction period and the zoning plan in the addendum. Underneath all this -- Lilienne's signature and your little forgery.

dialogueTree.title: White Envelope: "You take the legal documents out of..."
dialogueTree.text: You take the legal documents out of the envelope: a 12-40 month construction period and the zoning plan in the addendum. Underneath all this -- Lilienne's signature and an empty line, waiting for a signee.

dialogueTree.title: White Envelope: "You take the legal documents out of..."
dialogueTree.text: You take the legal documents out of the envelope: a 12-40 month construction period and the zoning plan in the addendum. Underneath all this -- your failed forgery.

dialogueTree.title: White Envelope: "You take the legal documents out of..."
dialogueTree.text: You take the legal documents out of the envelope: a 12-40 month construction period and the zoning plan in the addendum.
